page.title: 15KIRKLEVINGTON PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: The new school took the first of its 130 pupils.The building was extended in 1980.In 1985 there are five teachers and eight non teaching staff. Mrs Bishop is the headteacher.There are seven work bases and a central hall which doubles as a dining hall.A central library is organised in the dewey system and other rooms are used as maths resources,a reading room,a community/music room.Curriculum areas for all children are mathematics , language(spoken & written),topic,craft ,technology,religion education,P.E.& games.The school owns three computers a BBC Model 'B',pet and a ZX81.The Parents Association helps fund raise for the school.At 11+ pupils go on to Conyers Secondary School at Yarm.
